result.execSummary:
The defendant Brett M. Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample.
Huber Law, to run concurrent with any sentence presently being served.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brett M. Hill

records.addlTxt:
10:42 AM Defendant Brett M. Hill appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Jacalyn Christie Labre appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
State moves to delete the repeater enhancer in count 2.  Motion granted.
NO CONTEST to the amended charge in count 2, possess methamphetamine.  Convicted 
State moves to dismiss and read in count 1.  Motion granted. 
Defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for six (6) months, Huber Law, to run concurrent with any sentence presently being served. Court imposes costs in the amount of $518.00 due 12-31-2024 days or 10 days jail for failure to pay.  DNA sample also ordered.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.

11:28 a.m.  Defendant in custody. Public Defender unable to find counsel to represent defendant.  Defendant indicates he wants to waive attorney and proceed.  Court colloquy with defendant.  Defendant will proceed pro se.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.

2:32 pm - Defendant Brett M. Hill appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.  Initial appearance is set for 09-19-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Prior: 702 Chicago Street, Maniitowoc, WI 54220
RE:  Felony bail jumping as repeater, on 09-07-22.
Prints ordered (MTSO)
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of keeper drug house, possess drug paraphernalia, felony bail jumping and possess methamphetamine.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 09-12-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.  Bail is set at $10,000.00 cash with the conditions that he maintain absolute sobriety and have no contact with Scott Janquart and Paul Herman; except for 3rd party contact made by Scott Janquart or Paul Herman regarding his tenancy at 702 Chicago Street, Manitowoc, WI.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
